item.title: Gift for newborns
item.description:
Our children are our most important asset! They are our joy, our future, our procreation. And all children, at any age, love gifts! The Jewish community of Estonia gives memorable gifts to newborns! We decided that in this way we could bring additional joy to the homes where children are born. Original gifts for kids will remind parents of that happy day when a new smallest family member appeared in their home. By supporting this undertaking with us, you will be able to forever leave the memory of this joyful day in someone’s family, where a newborn was born. Together we can make someone’s day even brighter and someone’s happier.

item.title: Help affected families from COVID-19
item.description:
The “Ariel” project was created by the Jewish Community of Estonia during the 2008 crisis to help people who have experienced a difficult economic situation, mainly who have lost their jobs. In April 2020, in connection with the crisis situation as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, the “Ariel” anti-crisis center resumed its work. The economic impact of the coronavirus pandemic has affected many members of the Community. Within the framework of the “Ariel” project, information is collected and published through the community’s media channels, which helps to navigate the various components of life in crisis and after it. We help those who have lost their jobs or whose financial capabilities have changed significantly. Over the time that has passed since the resumption of the work of the anti-crisis center, more than 55 households have already contacted us and received support.

item.title: Help Jewish Community of Estonia
item.description:
The Forum of Estonian Jewry “Yahad” has long become the hallmark of the Jewish community in Estonia. On the days of the event, participants are given the opportunity to learn about the history of the community, as well as about its activities today. The rich program provides an opportunity for an interesting, but sometimes not easy choice: each of the participants can choose one of the events taking place in parallel in different audiences. Topics vary: Judaism, Jewish traditions, the cycle of Jewish life, culture, history, education, literature, psychology, politics, cooking, sports and much more. More than 50 events in the form of lectures, concerts, creative meetings, including film screenings of Jewish and Israeli authors, Jewish dances, excursions, discussions. We call for financial support for this distinctive phenomenon and the organizers of this annual event.

item.title: Help Jewish library
item.description:
The Estonian Jewish Community Library has existed since 1990. Today, the library fund, together with periodicals, is more than 7,500 items, covering almost the entire spectrum of Jewish topics: history, Judaism, philosophy, politics, fiction. The collection also contains dictionaries and popular books introducing Jewish traditions and holidays, and Jewish cuisine. Books need to be treated with care. Our library will be happy to accept any financial assistance for its own existence. You can help us preserve a piece of Jewish culture in Estonia

item.title: Help Jewish Museum
item.description:
The Estonian Jewish Museum, opened on December 17, 2008, is dedicated to the history of Estonian Jews from the beginning of the Jewish community in the first half of the 19th century to the present day. The stands provide information about the famous Jews of Estonia - scientists, doctors, lawyers, cultural and scientific workers, industrial workers, athletes and public figures. In addition to the main display at the headquarters of the Community, there are posters about Jews who have been awarded the state awards of the Republic of Estonia. The digitized version of the archive is available on the Internet and contains many photographs, memoirs, documents and other historical materials of interest to both researchers and fans of Jewish history in Estonia. In addition, a large collection of materials on Jewish subjects Judaica is available online in the National Archives of Estonia. The museum’s archive contains thousands of units of original documents donated to the museum by individuals and organizations. You can help us preserve unique museum values!

item.title: Help Jewish school
item.description:
School is the foundation of the future of our children, and the Jewish school is the foundation of the future of the Jewish community in Estonia! It is very important for us that the future generation of Jews in Estonia preserve and honor the history and traditions of the Jewish people, preserve their identity and involvement in the Community, so that children grow up and stick together, while receiving a high-quality, modern, competitive education. partners of the Jewish Community opened a new educational area where each of us can contribute to the development and filling of the learning environment of Jewish educational institutions!

item.title: Help Jewish students
item.description:
General education and entertainment programs for those who feel young enough to start or continue their studies. The Jewish Community calls for support of a wide range of programs for people who lead an active lifestyle. Non-formal education, a variety of entertainment, exciting travel and other unique projects provide an opportunity to expand your horizons and replenish your knowledge base. It is in our power to help young people choose a suitable education, take part in informal student communication in the future, pass on their experience to future generations.

item.title: Help Jewish young family
item.description:
In order to support young families in these difficult times, when COVID-19 reigns on the streets, this project of the Jewish Community exists. Each new unit of society faces a whole series of questions and challenges. By sharing experiences, helping each other, young Jewish families can overcome all adversity more easily. And who said that you can only share problems? It is more fun to celebrate holidays together, have fun, discuss world events and happy events in the family. To support young families, our community collects funds all year round for various family projects. Today you can do your bit to support young people who have decided to unite in families.

item.title: Help Jewish youth
item.description:
The Jewish community in Estonia actively supports the youth center programs for children and adolescents from 7 to 18 years old. Classes are conducted by young people - madrichs, who undergo special training in the Community. Since they themselves, for the most part, are still schoolchildren, they communicate with children informally. This is important in all respects: in the form of free communication, children better absorb useful and fascinating information, and madrichim, choosing a theme of the year and a topic for a specific lesson, each time discover new horizons for themselves in the boundless world of knowledge and the depth of Jewish topics in general. By helping our center, you will help the society in educating the young generation!

item.title: Help kids camp
item.description:
Preschool education, communication with peers, educational programs for children - all this is in our children’s camp. During the camp, children are supervised by professional teachers, educators and madrichs who make your children’s stay in the camp safe, interesting and unforgettable! The camp program is varied and designed to suit the age of the children. The leisure program for preschoolers always requires special responsibility and special attention. We call on everyone who can and wants to help the children’s camp “Bamba” to provide their support on a temporary or permanent basis.

item.title: Help kids soccer
item.description:
Children’s leisure, children’s health are priority areas in the Jewish Community of Estonia in matters of raising children. It is especially important to pay attention to children’s sports during the COVID-19 pandemic! Maccabi Football Club is a traditionally club with traditions dating back a century ago. Children’s sports, as well as the general physical development of our children, have always worried Estonian parents. Like any other sports club, it always needs sponsors or support. Our community encourages further development of children’s sports and contribute to the healthy future of our children!

item.title: Help pensioners
item.description:
The Social Center of the Jewish Community of Estonia extends a helping hand to the most vulnerable layers of the country’s Jewish population - pensioners, disabled people, single-parent families and needy children - so that they can live with dignity in the difficult conditions of the modern world. We also care about preserving Jewish values. In order for our wards to feel surrounded by care, it is very important for them that the support coming from the Jewish community is constant. We call on everyone who is not indifferent to the fate and life of the older generation to provide us with all possible support. It is in your power to brighten up the days of the oldest generation.

item.title: Help preschoolers
item.description:
Extracurricular and preschool education of children is an important element in any educational program. In the Jewish community of Estonia, a Sunday school and a child development school “Parpar” starts every autumn. We are waiting for both very kids with their parents, and older children. Sunday school will include three main areas of work: musical educational activities for toddlers with parents (from 1 to 3 years old when recruiting a group), two groups of preschoolers (from 3 to 6 years old), as well as a group for schoolchildren (from 7 to 9 years old ). The program is compiled separately for each group, taking into account the level of knowledge and age characteristics of the child. We are looking forward to the guys in our classes! And we urge to provide financial assistance to everyone who is not indifferent to the non-formal education of our children.

item.title: Help war veterans
item.description:
Providing veterans of the Great Patriotic War with a dignified old age is one of our most important tasks. The Veteran Organization of the Jewish Community of Estonia unites more than 90 people: they are veterans of the Great Patriotic War, veterans of military service, siege of Leningrad, former ghetto prisoners, workers of the military rear, widows of veterans. Without the tremendous heroic contribution of these people, many of us would not be alive today. Every year we try to attract new funds for projects related to the support of our beloved grandparents who have gone through the horrors of World War II. Our community calls on all caring people to make their contribution to supporting the elderly.

item.title: Help WIZO
item.description:
The World Women’s Zionist Organization WIZO was founded in 1920 in London. Its main goal was to raise funds among wealthy representatives of world Jewry for the restoration of the state of Israel. Today, the WIZO includes 52 countries, including Estonia, where this movement appeared in the 20s of the last century. In 1991, after the restoration of the country’s independence, the Estonian branch of the WIZO was officially registered again, which was engaged in the creation of a database of those in need of various types of assistance, the distribution of humanitarian aid received from abroad, and other socially oriented activities. And when the Social Center was created in the Jewish community, the members of the Estonian branch of the WIZO joined it as a volunteer group. We call on you to provide financial support to this noble movement!

item.title: Victims of ghettos
item.description:
For 20 years our veteran association has been taking care of its comrades, providing them with legal, moral and financial assistance. Many members of the Jewish community in Estonia went through the horrors of war, life in ghettos, concentration camps and survived. With their lives, they prove that the human spirit is strong. They live to pass this memory on to us, their descendants. This memory is hard, therefore, it is best to stick together. In cooperation with the Jewish Community of Estonia, the Association of Former Concentration Camp and Ghetto Prisoners strives to make the lives of their comrades brighter and richer. Today you can also support former prisoners of Nazism.

item.title: Example Talk
item.description:
Click on the Slides button above to view the built-in slides feature.

Slides can be added in a few ways:

  • Create slides using Wowchemy’s Slides feature and link using slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file
  • Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file
  • Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using shortcodes.

Further event details, including page elements such as image galleries, can be added to the body of this page.

item.title: GoJewish Philantropic Project
item.description:
Shalom!

GoJewish strengthens the Estonian Jewish community, especially during harsh COVID-19 times, by providing humanitarian support.

We collect donations, attract volunteers, work with partners and use resources to achieve our goal.

item.title: Slides
item.description:
Create slides in Markdown with Wowchemy

Wowchemy | Documentation

Features

  • Efficiently write slides in Markdown
  • 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides
  • Supports speaker notes
  • Mobile friendly slides

Controls

  • Next: Right Arrow or Space
  • Previous: Left Arrow
  • Start: Home
  • Finish: End
  • Overview: Esc
  • Speaker notes: S
  • Fullscreen: F
  • Zoom: Alt + Click
  • PDF Export: E

Code Highlighting

Inline code: variable

Code block:

porridge = "blueberry"
if porridge == "blueberry":
print("Eating...")

Math

In-line math: $x + y = z$

Block math:

$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$

Fragments

Make content appear incrementally

{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}}
{{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}}
{{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}

Press Space to play!

One Two Three

A fragment can accept two optional parameters:

  • class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS)
  • weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears

Speaker Notes

Add speaker notes to your presentation

{{% speaker_note %}}
- Only the speaker can read these notes
- Press `S` key to view
{{% /speaker_note %}}

Press the S key to view the speaker notes!

  • Only the speaker can read these notes
  • Press S key to view

Themes

  • black: Black background, white text, blue links (default)
  • white: White background, black text, blue links
  • league: Gray background, white text, blue links
  • beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links
  • sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links
  • night: Black background, thick white text, orange links
  • serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links
  • simple: White background, black text, blue links
  • solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links

Custom Slide

Customize the slide style and background

{{< slide background-image="/media/boards.jpg" >}}
{{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}}
{{< slide class="my-style" >}}

Custom CSS Example

Let’s make headers navy colored.

Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:

.reveal section h1,
.reveal section h2,
.reveal section h3 {
color: navy;
}

Questions?

Ask

Documentation

item.title: An example conference paper
item.description:
Click the Cite button above to demo the feature to enable visitors to import publication metadata into their reference management software.
Create your slides in Markdown - click the Slides button to check out the example.

Supplementary notes can be added here, including code, math, and images.
